qas.question: What is Atlantic City sometimes referred to?
The names of many properties near Atlantic City are used in which popular board game?
Who learned the game of Monopoly and took it to Atlantic City?
What location was originally featured in the  Monopoly game?
Who did Ruth Hoskins teach the game of Monopoly to?

context: Atlantic City (sometimes referred to as "<a0_0>Monopoly City<a0_0/>") has become well-known over the years for its portrayal in the U.S. version of the popular board game, <a1_0>Monopoly<a1_0/>, in which properties on the board are named after locations in and near Atlantic City. While the original incarnation of the game did not feature Atlantic City, it was in <a3_0>Indianapolis<a3_0/> that <a2_0>Ruth Hoskins<a2_0/> learned the game, and took it back to Atlantic City. After she arrived, Hoskins made a new board with Atlantic City street names, and taught it to <a4_0>a group of local Quakers<a4_0/>.
